section.title: Download
section.para: The binary release is available for download from the TeleStax Customer Support Portal at .

section.title: Documentation
section.para: When you download the binary release and extract the contents of the zip file, you will notice that the top level directory is named restcomm-camelgateway-<version> and within the restcomm-camelgateway-<version>/docs folder you will find the &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; Installation Guide and User Guide. For installation and usage guidance, please refer to these guides that will help you to install and configure the Gateway.

section.title: What's Included?
section.para:
This binary release includes:
docs: Contains all relevant documentation.
jboss-5.1.0.GA: The core server with two profiles "default" and "simulator". The "default" profile is a clean profile where you will have to start from scratch and configure the entire SS7 Stack and Camel Gateway. The "simulator" profile is a pre-configured profile to work with jss7-simulator.
resources: Contains SLEE MAP, JDBC and http-client RA jars.
tools: Contains SLEE tools and jss7-simulator.

section.title: Support
section.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; is fully supported by TeleStax. For help with the software or to raise bugs please login to your account at and follow the instructions.

formalpara.title: XML Payload Changes
formalpara.para:
&THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; version 6.2.0 and later are based on SS7 stack version 2.0. You must make note of the following minor XML payload changes.
<origAddress pc="11161" ssn="146"> <ai value="19"/> <gt type="org.mobicents.protocols.ss7.sccp.parameter.GT0100" tt="0" es="1" np="1" nai="4" digits="93781090614"/> </origAddress> <destAddress pc="0" ssn="146"> <ai value="18"/> <gt type="org.mobicents.protocols.ss7.sccp.parameter.GT0100" tt="0" es="1" np="1" nai="4" digits="93781090001"/> </destAddress>
The above has now been replaced by:
<origAddress pc="2" ssn="146"> <ai value="83"/> <gt type="GlobalTitle0100" tt="0" es="1" np="1" nai="4" digits="2222201"/> </origAddress> <destAddress pc="0" ssn="8"> <ai value="18"/> <gt type="GlobalTitle0100" tt="0" es="1" np="1" nai="4" digits="1111112"/> </destAddress>

formalpara.title: Support for new operations
formalpara.para:
&THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; added support for following three new Operations
connectToResource
furnishChargingInformation
promptAndCollectUserInformation

formalpara.title: Support for Multi-Tenancy
formalpara.para: Multi tenancy allows a single instance of &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; to connect to different operators, with each connection having its own links and point-codes.

formalpara.title: Call back to application for no activity timeout
formalpara.para: As of today CAMEL Gw keeps renewing the Dialog for every timeout without calling Application. This can potentially create a leak scenario and Dialog can linger for ever if there is no response from peer.

Add new feature where users can configure time limit for no activity and Gateway should call App intimating that there is no activity. App may choose to End dialog or ignore if it wants to continue the Dialog.

formalpara.title: Call back to application for providing assigned invoke id's
formalpara.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; now allows users to set value of property updateassignedinvokeids to true indicating that &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; can send back HTTP Request carrying assigned invokeid to Application if the previous response from App for original received request (for example IDP) carries the new cap message.

formalpara.title: log4j templates for debug, info and production
formalpara.para:
Added jboss-log4j.xml config files for debugging / default / production levels into jboss/server/default/deploy/restcomm-camel-gateway/log4j-templates:
jboss-log4j-debug.xml
jboss-log4j-default.xml
jboss-log4j-production.xml

section.title: Configuration Settings
section.para: You must perform post-installation configuration of the Gateway according to instructions in the &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; Admin Guide. Before using in Production, you must remember to fine-tune Memory and logging settings for better performance.

warning.para: Failure to configure memory, logging and other settings as per the instructions in the Admin Guide may result in poor performance of the Gateway.
